title: My location changed to specific location when no GPS signal
content:
Hi guys, 
I'm still facing a weird bug regarding my location. When my phone is not able to receive GPS signal, my location will "jump" to a specific location that I've "mocked" to back in June. When I'm outside where GPS signal is strong, my GPS sensors will pick up my current location again. I know this via my Google Location History.

I noticed this behavior when I first updated to Qbeta3. Back then the problem was overshadowed by the issue with corrupted "persist" folder (which caused the all the sensors to stop working) so I didn't point this out. I thought this issue is solved so I never bothered to check my location history until now.

The weirdest part is, this jump to specific location is observable even without setting up to my google account after I performed factory reset, which makes me believe that it is stored somewhere in the device, probably within data that survives full wipe such as persist folder.

The question is: What can I do to stop this behavior? and if possible, how do I delete this GPS data of this specific location from my phone?

I appreciate Google's support teams in the past in helping me on various issues, but I'd consider myself as advanced user, so help from more knowledgeable person is welcome.
